title: Pow(x, n)
content:
Implement pow(x, n), which calculates x raised to the power n (i.e., xn).

 

Example 1:

Input: x = 2.00000, n = 10
Output: 1024.00000

Example 2:

Input: x = 2.10000, n = 3
Output: 9.26100

Example 3:

Input: x = 2.00000, n = -2
Output: 0.25000
Explanation: 2-2 = 1/22 = 1/4 = 0.25

 

Constraints:

  • -100.0 < x < 100.0
  • -231 <= n <= 231-1
  • n is an integer.
  • Either x is not zero or n > 0.
  • -104 <= xn <= 104

    def myPow(self, x, n):
        """
        :type x: float
        :type n: int
        :rtype: float
        """
